text.0: what splendid one loudvoiced farstriding dost thou well knowing urge us to exalt with praises.
text.1: what give we him when his might dawned he fashioned the vṛtraslaying bolt and sent us waters.
text.2: he goes to end his work with lightning flashes wide is the seat his asura glory gives him.
text.3: with his companions not without his brother he quells saptathas magic devices.
text.4: on most auspicious path he goes to battle he toiled to win heavens light full fain to gain it.
text.5: he seized the hundredgated castles treasure by craft unchecked and slew the lustful demons.
text.6: fighting for kine the prize of war and i roaming among the berd be brings the young streams hither.
text.7: where footless joined without a car to bear them with jars for steeds they pour their flood like butter.
text.8: bold unsolicited for wealth with rudras he came the blameless having left his dwelling.
text.9: came seized the food of vamra and his consort and left the couple weeping and unsheltered.
text.10: lord of the dwelling he subdued the demon who roared aloud sixeyed and tripleheaded.
text.11: tṛta made stronger by the might he lent him struck down the boar with shaft whose point was iron.
text.12: he raised himself on high and shot his arrow against the guileful and oppressive foeman.
text.13: strong glorious manliest for us he shattered the forts of nabus when he slew the dasyus.
text.14: he like a cloud that rains upon the pasture hath found for us the way to dwell in safety.
text.15: when the hawk comes in body to the soma armed with his iron claws he slays the dasyus.
text.16: he with his potent friends gave up the mighty gave gusnia up to kutsa for affliction.
text.17: he led the lauded kavi he delivered atka as prey to him and to his heroes.
text.18: he with his gods who love mankind the wondrous giving like varuṇa who works with magic.
text.19: was known yet young as guardian of the seasons and he quelled araru fourfooted dernon.
text.20: through lauds of him hath auśija Ṛjiśvan burst with the mightys aid the stall of pipru.
text.21: when the saint pressed the juice and shone as singer he seized the forts and with his craft subdued them.
text.22: so swiftly asura for exaltation hath the great vamraka come nigh to indra.
text.23: he will when supplicated bring him blessing he hath brought all food strength a happy dwelling.
